content.text: XSL(T) Languages
XSLT is a language for transforming XML documents.
content.html: XSLT is a language for transforming XML documents.

content.text: XPath is a language for navigating in XML documents.
content.html: XPath is a language for navigating in XML documents.

content.text: XQuery is a language for querying XML documents.
content.html: XQuery is a language for querying XML documents.

content.text: It Started with XSL
XSL stands for E X tensible S tylesheet L anguage.
content.html: XSL stands for EXtensible Stylesheet Language.

content.text: The World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) started to develop XSL because there was a need for an XML-based Stylesheet Language.
content.html: The World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) started to develop XSL because there was a need for an XML-based Stylesheet Language.

content.text: CSS = Style Sheets for HTML
HTML uses predefined tags. The meaning of, and how to display each tag is well understood.
content.html: HTML uses predefined tags. The meaning of, and how to display each tag is well understood.

content.text: CSS is used to add styles to HTML elements.
content.html: CSS is used to add styles to HTML elements.

content.text: XSL = Style Sheets for XML
XML does not use predefined tags, and therefore the meaning of each tag is not well understood.
content.html: XML does not use predefined tags, and therefore the meaning of each tag is not well understood.

content.text: A <table> element could indicate an HTML table, a piece of furniture, or something else - and browsers do not know how to display it!
content.html: A <table> element could indicate an HTML table, a piece of furniture, or something else - and browsers do not know how to display it!

content.text: So, XSL describes how the XML elements should be displayed.
content.html: So, XSL describes how the XML elements should be displayed.

content.text: XSL - More Than a Style Sheet Language
XSL consists of four parts:
content.html: XSL consists of four parts:

content.text: With the CSS3 Paged Media Module , W3C has delivered a new standard for document formatting. So, since 2013, CSS3 is proposed as an XSL-FO replacement.
content.html: With the CSS3 Paged Media Module, W3C has delivered a new standard for document formatting. So, since 2013, CSS3 is proposed as an XSL-FO replacement.

content.text: What is XSLT?
XSLT = XSL Transformations
XSLT is the most important part of XSL.
content.html: XSLT is the most important part of XSL.

content.text: XSLT is used to transform an XML document into another XML document, or another type of document that is recognized by a browser, like HTML and XHTML. Normally XSLT does this by transforming each XML element into an (X)HTML element.
content.html: XSLT is used to transform an XML document into another XML document, or another type of document that is recognized by a browser, like HTML and XHTML. Normally XSLT does this by transforming each XML element into an (X)HTML element.

content.text: With XSLT you can add/remove elements and attributes to or from the output file. You can also rearrange and sort elements, perform tests and make decisions about which elements to hide and display, and a lot more.
content.html: With XSLT you can add/remove elements and attributes to or from the output file. You can also rearrange and sort elements, perform tests and make decisions about which elements to hide and display, and a lot more.

content.text: A common way to describe the transformation process is to say that XSLT transforms an XML source-tree into an XML result-tree .
content.html: A common way to describe the transformation process is to say that XSLT transforms an XML source-tree into an XML result-tree.

content.text: XSLT Uses XPath
XSLT uses XPath to find information in an XML document. XPath is used to navigate through elements and attributes in XML documents.
content.html: XSLT uses XPath to find information in an XML document. XPath is used to navigate through elements and attributes in XML documents.

content.text: If you want to study XPath first, please read our XPath Tutorial .
content.html: If you want to study XPath first, please read our XPath Tutorial.

content.text: How Does it Work?

In the transformation process, XSLT uses XPath to define parts of the source document that should match one or more predefined templates. When a match is found, XSLT will transform the matching part of the source document into the result document.
content.html: In the transformation process, XSLT uses XPath to define parts of the source document that should match one or more predefined templates. When a match is found, XSLT will transform the matching part of the source document into the result document.

content.text: XSLT Browser Support
All major browsers support XSLT and XPath.
content.html: All major browsers support XSLT and XPath.

content.text: XSLT is a W3C Recommendation
XSLT became a W3C Recommendation 16. November 1999 .
content.html: XSLT became a W3C Recommendation 16. November 1999.
